channel.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5vb9R0x_0NQ
It's a long documentary, but if you got some time it is worth a watch. Even though the damage to the planet has already been done.
Thoughts??

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

KempiScape:

You can go on ignoring this documentary, which is full of SOLID facts.

like I said I didn’t have an hour and a half to waste on what is probably a shitty documentary so I put it off, I’ll come back tonight and see what I think of it

Read full topic
item.source: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

KempiScape:

Radiation has always been bad for humans or any kind of animal, but it happens massively so we are basically killing our whole planet

You’re… you’re such a moron. Infrared radiation heats up the Earth, if we didn’t have greenhouse gases to keep this excess heat in, we would not survive on the planet. Also, if this has been proven but never made public, how did you find it out? Are you secretly linked to the investigation agency?

KempiScape:

Give me another explanation on the disappearance of bee’s, butterfly’s, and death birds falling out of the sky MASSIVELY. Coincidence? No.

I’m not quite sure what a death bird is (a tool used by Darth Vader?) but yes, I can give you another explanation. Everything in the world indirectly eats plants (they either eat plants, or eat something that eats plants, or eat something that eats something that eats plants, etc)… Now, compare the amount of chemical pesticides, herbicides and fertilisers used nowadays compared to the amount (and strength) of such products used 100, or even 50 years ago.

Read full topic

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

@niall

Radiation has always been bad for humans or any kind of animal, but it happens massively so we are basically killing our whole planet. Give me another explanation on the disappearance of bee’s, butterfly’s, and death birds falling out of the sky MASSIVELY. Coincidence? No.
You can go on ignoring this documentary, which is full of SOLID facts. Or you can start doing something about it, that’s up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:13, topic:472436”][quote author=Frell link=topic=590215.msg4178453#msg4178453 date=1355255576]
I had to do a huge powerpoint on brain cancer back in 10 grade. Routers, radios, cell phones etc were never proven to cause cancer
[/quote]

I was just going to state this, they were proven that the signals they send out aren’t harmful to humans. Humans may be effected by them but very very little, and it’ll be over a span of a lifetime, for someone who is on their phone all day.[/quote]

the science behind whether or not mobile phones cause cancer is inconclusive god damnit

Read full topic

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet

item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Stu:

Radio’s don’t cause cancer. Radio waves are naturally in the air.

UV-rays doesn’t cause cancer since they are natural in the air…
Bacteria doesn’t cause cancer since they are natural in the environment.
Big asteroids doesn’t cause mass death…

item.description:

I had to do a huge powerpoint on brain cancer back in 10 grade. Routers, radios, cell phones etc were never proven to cause cancer

I was just going to state this, they were proven that the signals they send out aren’t harmful to humans. Humans may be effected by them but very very little, and it’ll be over a span of a lifetime, for someone who is on their phone all day.

item.source: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

KempiScape:

If you look at earth’s magnetic field you can really see some strange patterns going on after the use of mobile phones.

the earths magnetic poles are also due for a “swap” which does mess with the magnetic field, correlation does not equal causation

KempiScape:

You are wrong, it has been proven but never made public. But i guess you believe what ever scientists tell you, well time will tell what happens. (don’t forget that cancer already increased massively)

again correlation does not equal causation and while some studies have found a link between cancer and mobile phone usage, other equally large studies have found no such link suggesting that the data is largely inconclusive

just the fact that you’re pulling a conspiracy theory out your ass is going to discredit a hell of a lot of what you want to put forward

Read full topic
item.source: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet

item.title: Electromagnetic radiaton (mobilephones, radio, tv) fking up the planet
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

[quote=“KempiScape, post:7, topic:472436”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=590215.msg4178454#msg4178454 date=1355255724]
I try to not look at GM’s posts too much, the powerful blue light is killing me. We need a red-like SMF theme.

tl;dr: The radiation you are talking about are weaker than normal light.
[/quote] You are correct, but it happens massively and so it is not weaker. If you look at earth’s magnetic field you can really see some strange patterns going on after the use of mobile phones. This could be of course a coincidence, but is highly unlikely. It is all about the frequency’s, i am not good at explaining but watch the video if you want explanation. (main language not english lol)

@Kronikz

There is nothing to debate, there is only to discuss.

@Frell

You are wrong, it has been proven but never made public. But i guess you believe what ever scientists tell you, well time will tell what happens. (don’t forget that cancer already increased massively)[/quote]

if its been proven but never made public THEN HOW DO U NO

ot: frell hit it on the spot when he said the stuff about chemicals in food etc

Read full topic
